properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 6 at 7:42PM PST until February 7 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...Persistent snow to continue over parts of northeast Washington
and north Idaho...

* WHAT...Snow for The Cascade Crest including Highway 2 between
Coles Corner and Stevens Pass. Additional snow accumulations of
up to 7 inches. Up to 12 inches possible in the higher
elevations.

* WHERE...Mazama, Stevens Pass, and Holden Village.

* WHEN...Until 3 AM PST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The difficult
driving conditions could impact travel over on Highway 2 at
Stevens Pass tonight.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will slowly rise late tonight
into Friday morning as the snow tapers off. This may lead to
wet and slushy conditions. Very dangerous avalanche conditions
continue at this time.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST FRIDAY FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
